alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:29PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of DeSoto, northwestern Marshall, northwestern Tate and southeastern Shelby Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1029 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eudora, or 7 miles west of Hernando, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Memphis, Byhalia, Walls, Lake Cormorant, Lynchburg, Eudora, Southeast Memphis, Lewisburg, Whitehaven, Arkabutla, Piperton, Newport, Trinity and Frees Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
